news.title: Rare earth stocks tumble as U.S. expects China to delay export controls
news.summary: U.S. officials say they expect China to delay introducing export controls on critical minerals. Shares of U.S.-listed rare earth miners fell on Monday.

news.title: Bessent lists five finalists for Fed chair job, and Trump says decision coming before the end of the year
news.summary: The Federal Open Market Committee meets this week, with an interest rate decision due Wednesday. The Fed's rate decision is expected to be made on Wednesday.

news.title: Tesla risks losing CEO Musk if $1 trillion pay package isn't approved, board chair says
news.summary: Tesla Board Chair Robyn Denholm said Elon Musk is key to the future of the EV maker as it focuses more on Full Self Driving and Optimus.

news.title: Lululemon is partnering with the NFL to release apparel for all 32 teams
news.summary: Lululemon is launching a new collection around the NFL. It will be the first time it will have products featuring all 32 teams.

news.title: OpenAI's spending bonanza has Wall Street focused on capex in Big Tech earnings reports
news.summary: Most of the tech megacaps report quarterly results this week. Investors are particular focused on capital expenditures. The tech sector is expected to report results on Tuesday.

news.title: I’m a veteran, 57, and on disability benefits. How do I persuade my wife, 52, to downsize so we can both retire?
news.summary: “I am now medically disabled/retired and receive $2,100 a month from Social Security,” she says. “I’m now medically Disabled/Retired. I am now Disabled/ Retired,’ she says, “and I am receiving Social Security.”

news.title: GameStop gets back in the spotlight, as it draws the attention of the re-energized meme-stock crowd
news.summary: The OG meme stock’s social-media post declaring the end of ‘the console wars’ has created plenty of buzz.

news.title: These stocks are falling back to Earth as Trump and China play nice
news.summary: Stocks of rare-earth companies take a hit as U.S.-China trade tensions ease. Stocks of Rare-Earth Companies take ahit as U.-S. trade tensions easing. Rare-earth Companies are made up of companies that make rare earths.

news.title: Banks are still compensating investors over Madoff fraud. Another $1.1 billion might be paid out.
news.summary: HSBC has said it has set aside $1.1 billion related to the biggest Ponzi scheme in history. HSBC has said that the money will be used to help victims of the scheme. The company has not revealed how much of the money has been set aside.

news.title: My husband and I have $7K in Social Security and $2.5 million in stocks. What could go wrong?
news.summary: “I hope to live off of the combination of Social Security and the TIPS ladder,” he says. “I’m not looking to get rich, I just want to get by.”
